intro: Lappula echinophora, commonly known as the spiny lappula, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Papaveraceae family, which includes poppies and other flowering plants. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and covered in fine hairs. Lappula echinophora is typically found in dry, rocky habitats and is often used in traditional herbal medicine.
